com.matrixone.apps.domain.util
Class AccessUtil

java.lang.Object
  com.matrixone.apps.domain.util.AccessUtil

public class AccessUtil
extends java.lang.Object

The AccessUtil class represents a utility class for manipulating accesses in the AEF.

Version:
AEF 9.5.0.0 - Copyright (c) 2001, MatrixOne, Inc.

static Access getUserEditAccess(Context context, java.lang.String objectVault)
          0 = Read 1 = Modify 2 = Delete 3 = Checkout 4 = Checkin 5 = Lock 6 = Unlock 7 = Grant 8 = Revoke 9 = ChangeOwner 10 = Create 11 = Promote 12 = Demote 13 = Enable 14 = Disable 15 = Override 16 = Schedule 17 = Revise 18 = Changelattice 19 = ChangeName 20 = ChangePolicy 21 = ChangeType 22 = From Connect 23 = ToConnect 24 = FromDisconnect 25 = ToDisconnect 26 = Freeze 27 = Thaw 28 = Execute 29 = ModifyForm 30 = ViewForm 31 = Show 32 = All 33 = None This method will give the access object with field in access bits for Allow User Edit depending on emxSourcing.AllowUserEditAccess property from suppliercentralnet.properties This property can be company specific by adding company vault at the end.

                                      java.lang.String str2)
                               throws java.lang.Exception

str1 - folder access term
str2 - inherited access term
Returns:
String Access Term

java.lang.Exception - if the operation fails

grantAccess

public static void grantAccess(Context context,
                               BusinessObjectList busList,
                               AccessList accessList,
                               java.lang.String grantor)
                        throws FrameworkException
Grant Access to given object list with given accesslist.

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busList - the BusinessObjectList of object for which access need to be granted
accessList - the AccessList of access objects for each grantee
grantor - the String grantor user name
Throws:
FrameworkException - if the operation fails
Since:
AEF 9.5.1.0

                                BusinessObjectList busList,
                                StringList userList)
                         throws FrameworkException

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busList - the BusinessObjectList of object for which access need to be revoked
userList - the StringList of users for whom access need to be revoked
Throws:
FrameworkException - if the operation fails
Since:
AEF 9.5.1.0

                                           java.lang.String objectId)
                                    throws FrameworkException
Check to see if the logged in user has access to edit/grant access on an object

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
objectId - the id of the object
Returns:
the boolean value of the hasAccess object
Throws:
FrameworkException - if the operation fails
Since:
AEF 9.5.1.3

getUserEditAccess

public static Access getUserEditAccess(Context context,
                                       java.lang.String objectVault)
                                throws FrameworkException
0 = Read 1 = Modify 2 = Delete 3 = Checkout 4 = Checkin 5 = Lock 6 = Unlock 7 = Grant 8 = Revoke 9 = ChangeOwner 10 = Create 11 = Promote 12 = Demote 13 = Enable 14 = Disable 15 = Override 16 = Schedule 17 = Revise 18 = Changelattice 19 = ChangeName 20 = ChangePolicy 21 = ChangeType 22 = From Connect 23 = ToConnect 24 = FromDisconnect 25 = ToDisconnect 26 = Freeze 27 = Thaw 28 = Execute 29 = ModifyForm 30 = ViewForm 31 = Show 32 = All 33 = None This method will give the access object with field in access bits for Allow User Edit depending on emxSourcing.AllowUserEditAccess property from suppliercentralnet.properties This property can be company specific by adding company vault at the end.

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
objectVault - the String vault of the object to get company specific property
Returns:
the vaule of the boAccess object
Throws:
FrameworkException - if the operation fails
Since:
9-5-3-0

                                            java.lang.String objectId,
                                            java.util.ArrayList personList,
                                            java.util.ArrayList access)
                                     throws FrameworkException
Throws:
FrameworkException
